original_title: Avant-Garde 1927-1937 SURREALISM AND EXPERIMENT IN BELGIAN CINEMA
overview: At the end of the nineteen twenties, two future film-makers discover their medium. Charles Dekeukeleire and Henri Storck will become famous documentary film-makers, but their debuts consist of experiments and the search of a 'pure cinema'. With the occasional surrealists Henri d'Ursel and Ernst Moerman, they make up the first avant-garde generation in Belgian cinema.
title: Avant-Garde 1927-1937 SURREALISM AND EXPERIMENT IN BELGIAN CINEMA
